member.name: P:CMS.Modules.ResourceInfo.ResourceHasFiles
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this module has associated files or assemblies.
member.remarks: Modules with associated files or assemblies are considered available only when these files are present. Associated files and files are detected by convention. The application checks whether there is a {ResourceName} subfolder in the CMSModules folder or there is a registered module entry with the same name.

member.name: P:CMS.Modules.ResourceInfo.ShowInDevelopment
member.summary: Gets or sets the value saying if the resource is shown in Development.

member.summary: Gets or sets the resource url.

member.summary: Object last modified.

member.name: P:CMS.Modules.ResourceInfo.ResourceIsInDevelopment
member.summary: Indicates if resource is in development. Custom system module is always considered as developed and cannot be set to false

member.name: P:CMS.Modules.ResourceInfo.IsEditable
member.summary: Indicates if resource is editable (resource is in development or development mode is enabled).

member.name: M:CMS.Modules.ResourceInfoProvider.IsResourceAvailable(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a value indicating whether the specified resource (module) is available.
member.remarks: A resource is available only if a database record exists and a module with the same is installed. A resource is also available if a negative identifier value is specified.
member.returns: True, if the specified resource exists; otherwise, false.

member.summary: Returns true if resource(specified by resource name) is considered as system

member.summary: Version from which is UI element present in CMS.

member.summary: Indicates whether the element is available in global context and some restrictions are not applied to it.

member.name: P:CMS.Modules.UIElementInfo.ElementCheckModuleReadPermission
member.summary: Indicates if the system should check the "read" permission for the module to which the current UI element is assigned. When the "read" permission doesnt exist for the current module, this setting has no effect.

member.name: T:CMS.Modules.VirtualModuleManager
member.summary: Provides a registration of virtual modules.
member.remarks: Virtual modules are represented only by a folder in the CMSModules folder, there is no corresponding class derived from the Module class.

member.name: M:CMS.Modules.VirtualModuleManager.RegisterVirtualModules
member.summary: Registers virtual modules.
member.remarks: Virtual modules are registered only if the application is a web application.

member.name: M:CMS.Modules.VirtualModuleManager.RegisterVirtualModule(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Registers a virtual module with the specified properties.
member.param: A relative path to the module folder (for example "~/CMSModules/Forums").
